intro: Baratostachys, commonly known as the slender spurge, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Euphorbiaceae. It is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically surrounded by modified leaves called bracts. Baratostachys thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along streams. It is a herbaceous perennial that can grow up to 1 meter in height.
